meanings.definition: Containing or serving as an encomium; eulogistic.
meanings.sent1: The encomiastic speech at the ceremony praised the hardworking students.
meanings.sent2: Her encomiastic words about the chef's skills were well-deserved.
meanings.sent3: The encomiastic letter from the fan to the singer was full of admiration.
meanings.sent4: The encomiastic review of the new restaurant made everyone eager to try it.
meanings.sent5: The encomiastic tone of the article highlighted the author's appreciation for nature.

meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or characterized by praise.
meanings.sent1: The encomiastic remarks about the team's performance lifted their spirits.
meanings.sent2: His encomiastic attitude towards his colleagues created a positive work environment.
meanings.sent3: The encomiastic comments on the painting made the artist blush with joy.
meanings.sent4: The encomiastic atmosphere at the event made everyone feel appreciated.
meanings.sent5: The encomiastic gestures of gratitude were heartwarming to witness.
